unnormalised: When looking at property listings, pay attention to how addresses are written. You might see "Plot no. 123, XYZ Colony, near ABC School, Bangalore, 560001" or sometimes "123/A, XYZ Colony, Bengaluru - 560001." Both refer to the same place but use slightly different formats. Always verify the pincode (e.g., 560001) for accurate location as variations in street names & area codes exists and can easily lead to confusion. Also cross-check with online maps; what seems like "XYZ Colony, Bangalore, 560037" might actually be on the outskirts.
normalised: When looking at property listings, pay attention to how addresses are written. You might see "Plot number one hundred and twenty three, X-Y-Z Colony, near A-B-C School, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty thousand one" or sometimes "one hundred and twenty three slash A, X-Y-Z Colony, Bengaluru - five hundred and sixty thousand one." Both refer to the same place but use slightly different formats. Always verify the pincode (for example, five hundred and sixty thousand one) for accurate location as variations in street names and area codes exists and can easily lead to confusion. Also cross-check with online maps; what seems like "X-Y-Z Colony, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty thousand thirty seven" might actually be on the outskirts.
